messages.subject: newbie intro
messages.msgSnippet: hi, i just joined this group. i m stacie (26), married 9 yrs. to ben and mom to zoë ( very, very 5 ), madilyn (4 soon) and gavin (1, going on 5 ). we live in
messages.messageBody:
hi, i just joined this group. i'm stacie (26), married 9 yrs. to ben
and mom to zoë ("very, very 5"), madilyn (4 soon) and gavin
(1, "going on 5"). we live in pasadena, MD. we've been "unschooling"
since birth. soon i'll be contacting the county to let them know
we're starting kindergarten with zoë. is there anyone else here
living in maryland?

active interests in this household include: yoga, origami, knitting,
sculpting, reading, writing, video games, guinea pigs, computers &
networking, gourmet cooking & grilling, winemaking & tasting,
dioramas, collage & scrapbooking, U2 (the rock band), environmentally
friendly homemaking, "indigo children", indie films, musicals, rubber
duckies and playing make-believe.

i'm looking for an online discussion community because i too feel a
tremendous weight being home all day with the kids. some days are
better than others. i believe a little commiseration can go a long
way! (and heather, it sounds to me like you are doing a fine job!
<hug>)

warmly,
stacie
//p.s. sorry about no caps. i can only post when 'nak'.

messages.subject: newbie intro
messages.msgSnippet: Hi everyone! I m not sure I sent an intro to this list! I m  FT USing mom to three rambunctious boys, 8yo, soon-to-be 7yo and just-turned 3yo. This will be our
messages.messageBody:
Hi everyone!
I'm not sure I sent an intro to this list! I'm FT USing mom to three
rambunctious boys, 8yo, soon-to-be 7yo and just-turned 3yo. This will be our
third year (!?!) unschooling here in central Indiana, and we just love it!
Right now, the two oldest are out feeding and watering our dogs, and
then we are heading to one of the state parks near here to a naturalist-led
program on fireflies!

I've been enjoying reading the list:)
e-mail ya soon!
Tamara

"I would be most happy if my children grew up to be the
kind of people who think decorating consists of building
enough bookshelves." -- Anna Quindlen
